page.title: 02Farming
page.content: The land in the valley of the River Font is primarily agricultural, divided equally between arable and pasture. There is one landowner, Raleigh Trevelyan, whose family have lived at Netherwitton Hall since 1770. There are 10 tenant farms in this area. The crops grown are wheat, barley, oats, rape, turnips, potatoes, peas(for the cattle), beans(for game), silage, and some hay. These are brought in for the winter feeding of the beasts. The beasts are brought into cattleyards for the winter (to save poaching the grass), and fed on silagand grain. The resulting manure is used to fertilise the fields, together with artificial fertilisers. Most of the farms have sheep, sold for meat, fleeces as secondary products.
